intro: Hedyotis setifera, commonly known as slender dotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and slender, creeping stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Hedyotis setifera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
